biography.value: Programmed with knowledge of Strixhaven’s extensive lore catalog, cogwork archivists serve as keepers of the university’s various libraries. The archivists’ towering metal frames are equipped with long, articulated limbs and retractable conservator tools, which they use to organize and preserve documents from throughout Strixhaven’s winding history. Many cogwork archivists can be found among the towering shelves of the Biblioplex, simultaneously retrieving scrolls for curious students while keeping a stern eye on any rowdy groups that might disrupt the quiet atmosphere.

description.value:
The archivist makes two Grasping Limb attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage, and the target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 14). The archivist can have no more than two targets &Reference[grappled]{grappled} at a time.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The archivist casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[int]{Intelligence} as the spellcasting ability:

At will: dancing lights, prestidigitation

2/day: silence

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. The archivist has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You create up to four torch-sized lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four lights into one glowing vaguely &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.

macro.name: Dancing Lights

description.value:
This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving &Reference[material]{material} for 1 hour.
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.


If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the &Reference[sphere]{sphere} is immune to &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage, and creatures are &Reference[deafened]{deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a &Reference[vocal]{verbal} component is impossible there.

macro.name: Silence
